metadata.Title: CVE-2021-39686 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
In several functions of binder.c, there is a possible way to represent the wrong domain to SELinux due to a race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-200688826References: Upstream kernel

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39686` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-17-generic - 5.15.0-17.17
linux-image-5.15.0-17-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-17.17
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-17-generic - 5.15.0-17.17
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-17-generic-64k - 5.15.0-17.17
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-17-lowlatency - 5.15.0-17.17
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> AppArmor is the default MAC LSM for Ubuntu, not SELinux, though it is possible to boot with SELinux enforcement in place.
